content:
Although the media have focused on London, the big increases are found elsewhere

THERE have been 119 murders in London this year. That is about the same as the number killed in the whole of 2017, excluding terrorist attacks. Four in ten victims were 24 years old or younger. In the six days from October 31st, there were five fatal stabbings in the capital.

The media has good reason to pay close attention to murders in the city. Stabbings are far more common in London than anywhere else in the country, and not only because it is so much bigger: it sees more violence per person than less populous areas do. Londoners make up 15% of the population of England and Wales, yet in 2017-18 the capital accounted for 22% of all murders and 36% of knife crime.

Yet the biggest increases in knife crime have been outside London (see chart). Since 2010-11 it has risen by a tenth there, and by a third in the rest of England and Wales. During the same period, knife crime leapt more sharply than the national average in the patches around Sheffield, Leeds and Liverpool. The number of stabbings began to tick up in North Wales, Norfolk and Essex well before they did in London.

What explains the rise? Labour blames spending cuts: the number of police officers has fallen by 15% since 2010. Meanwhile new demands on officers, such as a recent run of accusations of decades-old sex abuse, take up their time. Another plausible explanation is a shift in the drugs market. A boom in the supply of crack cocaine has encouraged city gangsters to expand into towns once dominated by small-time dealers. Competition has sparked violent turf wars.

Read more in Capital offences

ex: n. 埃塞克斯(英格兰东海岸一郡)
网络 埃塞克斯大学；艾塞克斯；艾塞克斯大学
n. 伦敦人
网络 伦敦客；伦敦公园；伦敦儿
n. 威尔士
网络 威尔斯；英国威尔斯；英国威尔士
n. 控告，指控；谴责

wp.accusation evidence: 检举证据;指控证据;控告的证据

eg2: Lyndon was exonerated from the  of cheating.
林登被免受进行欺骗的指控。
He evidenced his  with some material evidence.
他以一些物证作为控告的证据。
Were they en route to a public , a mass trial or sentencing or even a mass execution?
他们是要去接受公众控告，群众审讯或者是判决抑或甚至是一场群众处决？

ex: n. 可卡因；古柯碱
网络 古柯硷；柯卡因；可卡因类
vt. 使破裂；打开；变声
vi. 破裂；爆裂
n. 裂缝；声变；噼啪声
adj. 最好的；高明的

wp.Dominate Mind: 支配意识;他身边的两个守护者会随即控制玩家;把握认识;精神控制

ex: vt. 控制；支配；占优势；在…中占主要地位
vi. 占优势；处于支配地位
eg2: She must dominate her passions.
她必须控制自己的情感。
They had the ambition to  this small country.
他们有控制这个小国的野心。
Never allow her dominate you in any way, do not buy her drinks or hold/watch her purse for her.
绝对不要让她以任何的方式支配你，不要为她买饮料，不要帮她拿着或看着包包。

ex: n. 歹徒；匪徒；土匪
网络 暴徒；强盗；流氓
eg2: Chicago gangsters
芝加哥的歹徒

ex: n. 补丁；斑块（patch的复数）；修补程序
eg2: There are patches of yellow and red.
有一些黄色和红色的斑块。
If the kernel tree is clean, the patches should apply without any problems.
如果内核树没问题，那么补丁的应用就不会有任何问题。
Through the course of releasing my code, I have received a number of valuable suggestions and enhancement patches from users of these modules.
在将代码公开的过程中，我从这些模块的用户那里得到了许多有价值的建议和增强性补丁。

wp.plausible explanation: 似有道理的解释;言之成理
wp.plausible e: 似乎可信的;似是而非的
wp.plausible reasoning: 合情推理;似真推理;猜测式推理;基于近似理论

ex: adj. 貌似可信的，花言巧语的；貌似真实的，貌似有理的
eg2: But what if your mother and I created an environment where you would grow up to have a more plausible career than your dad?
但是如果事我和你的妈妈给你创造了一个比你爸爸更好的生长环境，使你可以有一个更合理的职业生涯呢？
Though they can't yet prove that this is what happened on Mars, it seems like a plausible explanation, and doesn't require water for the reddening process.
虽然他们目前还不能证实这就是在火星上所发生的事情，但这似乎是一个很合理的解释，且变红的过程并不需要水的参与。

ex: adj. 人口众多的；人口密集的
网络 人口稠密的；上帝也疯狂；人口多的
eg2: one of America's most populous states
美国人口大州之一

ex: n. 火花；电火花；火星；活力
v. 引发；触发；冒火花；飞火星
网络 斯巴达克；斯帕克；斯巴克
eg2: A shower of sparks flew up the chimney.
烟囱里飞出无数火星。
sparks from a faulty light switch
漏电的电灯开关发出的火花
A spark ignites the fuel in a car engine.
汽车发动机中的燃料由火花点燃。
a spark of hope
一线希望
As a writer he seemed to lack creative spark.
作为作家，他似乎缺少创作激情。
the sparks of revolution
革命的导火线
Sparks flew at the meeting(= there was a lot of argument) .
会上争论激烈，火星四溅。
The proposal would spark a storm of protest around the country.
这一提案将引发全国性的抗议浪潮。
Winds brought down power lines, sparking a fire.
大风刮断电线，引起了火灾。
The riots were sparked off by the arrest of a local leader.
骚乱是因逮捕一名当地领导人而触发的。
a sparking, crackling fire
噼啪直响、火星飞迸的火
The game suddenly sparked to life.
比赛突然变得激烈起来。

ex: n. 草皮；（铺草坪用的）草皮块；泥煤；泥炭
v. 用草皮覆盖
网络 草地；地盘；势力范围
eg2: newly laid turf
新铺的草皮
the hallowed turf of Wimbledon, etc.(= the grass used for playing a sport on)
温布尔登等被视为神圣的运动场草皮
He feels more confident on home turf .
他在主场感到更有信心。

ex: adj. 暴力的；猛烈的
eg2: The black cloud presignified a violent storm.
乌云预示着一场猛烈的暴风雨。
The speaker lashed the young people into violent action.
那个演讲者煽动青年人搞暴力行动。
The enemy troops began to reel in defeat under our violent attack.
敌军在我方的猛烈攻击下开始溃退。

Title: Knife-crime in Britain is rising almost everywhere

paperStatistics.title: Knife-crime in Britain is rising almost everywhere
paperStatistics.desc: Although the media have focused on London, the big increases are found elsewhere
